Homepage.title: Here, find and share information to succeed in your project
Homepage.site dispo: R√©fugi√©s.info is available in the following languages:
Homepage.mobileAppSubtitle: Free of charge and accessible to all, it is aimed at refugees and those accompanying them. You will find simplified information, translated into 7 languages, that can be listened to and easily shared.
Homepage.mobileAppFormInstructions: You will receive the link to download the app by message. Don't worry, we won't keep your number!
Homepage.whyTitle: Why and when should you use R√©fugi√©s.info?
Homepage.whyAccordionTitle1: Find information on all administrative procedures
Homepage.whyAccordionText1: Once international protection is granted, many administrative procedures must be undertaken. R√©fugi√©s.info publishes practical information sheets to make these procedures easier to understand. Today, there are {{count}} sheets, covering all aspects of integration.
Homepage.whyAccordionTitle2: Discover the actions in your territory
Homepage.whyAccordionText2: R√©fugi√©s.info allows you to orient your beneficiaries within your territory and beyond. By entering your department, you will find the list of actions available around you to welcome and support refugees. Please note that the platform is collaborative: some territories are better mapped than others.
Homepage.whyAccordionTitle3: Share information easily with your beneficiaries
Homepage.whyAccordionText3: During an appointment, you can send an interesting sheet directly to the phone of the person you are accompanying. Your personal number remains anonymous.
Homepage.whyAccordionText4: On R√©fugi√©s.info, information is simplified, translated into 7 languages and can be listened to. The cards can be used to communicate or explain information. This tool can thus facilitate the work of social support.
Homepage.resourcesText: We provide you with a set of digital and physical tools to discover the project and talk about it around you: animated videos, multilingual flyers, presentation brochures, visuals, etc.
Homepage.helpUsSubtitle: Refugees.info is a collaborative project, everyone can participate, just like on Wikipedia. Together, we can create a large number of sheets and promote the project.
Homepage.helpUsCardHelp1: Do you have or know of initiatives that promote the integration of refugees?
Homepage.helpUsCardText1: Take part in enriching the site by writing new entries yourself.
Homepage.helpUsCardHelp2: Do you speak Ukrainian, Persian/Dari, Arabic, English, Pashto, Russian, Tigrinya?
Homepage.helpUsCardText2: Help us translate on a voluntary basis to make information accessible to as many people as possible.
Homepage.helpUsCardHelp3: Have you noticed an omission or an error in the files?
Homepage.helpUsCardText3: Report it! Together, we can ensure that the information is up to date and reliable.
Homepage.figuresTitle: R√©fugi√©s.info already has thousands of users
Homepage.figuresSubtitle2: users have found the sheets useful
Homepage.figuresSubtitle3: sheets updated in the last three months
Homepage.communityTitle: An original community committed to refugees
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle1: List the actions promoting the integration of refugees in the territories.
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle2: Drive their scheme files and support the writers.
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle3: Composed of volunteers and professionals who write sheets on administrative procedures to facilitate their understanding.
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle4: Participate in the translation of information to make it accessible to as many people as possible.
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle5: Proofread, harmonise and validate the translations proposed by the volunteers.
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle6: Help to raise awareness of the project among local actors and refugees.
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle7: Disseminate the project's content and news to raise awareness and promote information among the refugee public.
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle8: Test the functionalities before their development in order to create an experience adapted to the users' needs.
Homepage.communityCardSubtitle9: Coordinates all the communities of contributors and organises the smooth running of the project.
Homepage.newsletterSubtitle: Follow the evolution of the R√©fugi√©s.info project and be informed of our events and news.
Homepage.trainingTitle: Take part in our training sessions
Homepage.trainingSubtitle: Come and discover the project online or in person and ask all your questions.

UserFavorites.Comment ajouter: How do I add card to my favourites?

QuiSommesNous.problem_1_subheader: Better understanding fosters better welcoming. The words "migrant", "asylum seeker", or "refugee" can all have different definitions. R√©fugi√©s.info is designed for statutory refugees, meaning people to whom France has granted international protection because their lives are threatened in their country of origin
QuiSommesNous.problem_2_subheader: Constant legislative evolution, multiplying organizations, and administrative complexity make it difficult to understand one's rights and duties. R√©fugi√©s.info centralizes reliable, up-to-date, accessible information for this reason.
QuiSommesNous.problem_3_header2: Avoid breaks in the support system
QuiSommesNous.problem_3_subheader2: Moving, changing life project... With each new partner, you have to start from scratch. R√©fugi√©s.info purports to offer refugees the opportunity to create a personal journey that they can easily share with their caregivers.
QuiSommesNous.contributive_1_subheader: Openness and transparency are at the core of R√©fugi√©s.info. The source code of the site is publicly available. An open network helps identity needs and propose new solutions
QuiSommesNous.contributive_2_subheader: People on the ground are best able to identify and list local actions. R√©fugi√©s.info allows different geographic areas to identify and promote their initiatives -- and to discover new ones
QuiSommesNous.contributive_3_subheader: By giving everyone the opportunity to easily contribute to the platform, like on Wikipedia, R√©fugi√©s.info promotes new forms of micro-engagement, allowing new people to get involved in the support of refugees
QuiSommesNous.subheader2: implemented by the Diair and developed by the Mednum
QuiSommesNous.recenser-description: Numerous devices are emerging in France to welcome and support refugees. These devices may not be visible enough and may not benefit enough people. R√©fugi√©s.info's mission is to identify and make both visible and accessible these many initiatives
QuiSommesNous.vulgariser-description: As soon as they are granted international protection, refugees access common law, which triggers numerous administrative procedures. R√©fugi√©s.info publishes practical sheets to popularise these procedures and gathers volunteers to translate them into the main languages of integration.
QuiSommesNous.parcours-description: Obtaining asylum mainly means rebuilding. A home, a network, a vocation. Having to leave one's country often confuses one's bearings, ambitions and objectives. R√©fugi√©s.info offers a structuring tool allowing refugees to reach their life goals faster and more serenely.
QuiSommesNous.appel-a-manifestation1: These organisations have signed a Call for Expression of Interest and participate in the evolution of the platform.
QuiSommesNous.appel-a-manifestation2: If you represent an organisation linked to the integration of refugees and wish to join the adventure, download the call below and send it to nour@refugies.info. We will contact you to define the terms of our partnership.

Publish.writeModalDescDispositif: Programme, workshop, training course, online course, reception desk or any other device directly accessible by refugees.
Publish.writeModalDescDemarche: Explain a step-by-step administrative process to make it easier for refugees to access and understand.

Translate.title: Help us translate!
Translate.subtitle: {{nbBenevoles}} have already helped us translate {{nbMots}} words. Like them, become a volunteer translator to make information accessible to as many people as possible.
Translate.whoSubtitle: Are you a refugee, a social worker, a French citizen or a volunteer in an association? You can help us translate! Here are the conditions to be met:
Translate.whoCardText1: No proof is required, but it is preferable to have a very good command of the written language: Ukrainian, Persian/Dari, Arabic, English, Pashto, Russian, Tigrinya.
Translate.whoCardText2: You need to be able to read and write well in French to understand the original text and not distort the message.
Translate.whoCardText3: The translation tool is only available on a computer connected to the Internet; you cannot access it using your telephone.
Translate.needTitle: We are currently looking for translators in:
Translate.stepsTitle: What are the steps involved in translating a form?
Translate.stepsWarningMobile: Please note that you can only translate a form on a computer.
Translate.stepsText1: Enter your email address and password, and you're ready to use the translation tool.
Translate.stepsText2: Once you have chosen your language, you can access all the sheets to be translated. Click on a sheet to start translating it.
Translate.stepsSubtitle3: Translate the sheet from the automatic suggestion
Translate.stepsText3: When you arrive on a sheet, you will find an initial translation. Please note that this is an automatic translation. You need to work on it and correct it!
Translate.stepsList3Item1: Keep your sentences simple and avoid using dialect.
Translate.stepsList3Item2: Explain ideas specific to French culture and administration (attestation, renewal, etc.) but keep the important words if there is no translation in your language.
Translate.stepsList3Item3: Avoid word-for-word translations, and don't hesitate to correct machine translations.
Translate.stepsSubtitle4: An expert proofreads and validates your translation
Translate.stepsText4a: An expert will proofread your translation before publishing the sheet.
Translate.stepsText4b: You will receive an email as soon as the sheet you have translated is published on the R√©fugi√©s.info website and mobile application.
Translate.nextTitle: Be proud of your translation and share it!
Translate.nextText1: Your name and photo are visible at the bottom of your sheet, along with the other contributors who helped translate it.
Translate.nextText2: Don't hesitate to share them with your friends and family, they might find them useful.
Translate.helpTileText1: In the help centre, you'll find videos and articles to help you translate your entry.
Translate.faqAccordionTitle1: What level of education do I need to become a translator?
Translate.faqAccordionText1: No qualifications are required to become a translator, but it is preferable to have a good command of the language you are translating into. If it is not your mother tongue, it is advisable to be a language student or to already have experience in translation. You need to be able to read and write well in French to understand the original text and not distort the message.
Translate.faqAccordionTitle2: How many sheets do I have to translate?
Translate.faqAccordionText2: You translate at your own pace; we don't ask you to do a specific number of files. If you translate more than 10,000 words (between 20 and 30 files), we can reward your commitment by giving you a certificate of solidarity translation.
Translate.faqAccordionTitle3: How long does it take to translate a file?
Translate.faqAccordionText3: On average, a fact sheet is 300 words long. We estimate that it takes between 15 and 30 minutes to improve the proposed machine translation. Please note the following points: Keep sentences simple and avoid using dialect. Explain ideas that are specific to French culture and administration (attestation, renewal, etc.) but keep the important words if there is no translation in your language. Avoid word-for-word translation; don't hesitate to correct the machine translation. You can stop translating a file at any time. Your progress is recorded, and that's a big help!
Translate.faqAccordionTitle4: What are the advantages of translating files on R√©fugi√©s.info?
Translate.faqAccordionText4: Thanks to your precious help, the people who use the site and the application can find the information in their own language. It's also an enriching experience for you, as you learn to use a new tool, improve your French and contribute to a national project.
Translate.faqAccordionTitle5: Will new languages be available soon?
Translate.faqAccordionText5: Translating R√©fugi√©s.info into a new language is possible. The decision depends on current events and the number of people who might be interested in this new language. If you speak another language and would like to translate content to make it accessible to your community, please fill in this form.
Translate.registerSubtitle: Create your account to start translating the sheets.
Translate.registerLoggedIn: Now you know everything, you can translate your first sheet.
Translate.registerMobile: Go to your computer to create your account and start translating your sheets.
